TEXT: Each of the first CARDINAL applicants was , and the fifth applicant is , a NORP national . Their particulars appear below .
The respondent Government were represented by PERSON , their Agent , who was succeeded in that function by PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The first applicant , Mr PERSON , was born in DATE and died in DATE . He was the father of the fifth applicant . The second applicant , ORG , was born in DATE and died on DATE . She was the wife of the first applicant and the mother of the fifth applicant . The third applicant , Mr PERSON , was born in DATE and died on DATE . He was the husband of the fourth applicant , PERSON ORG , who was born in DATE and died in DATE . The third applicant was the uncle of the fifth applicant and the fourth applicant was his aunt .

The fifth applicant , Mr PERSON , was born in DATE and resides in GPE . He originally represented the first CARDINAL applicants and then expressed the wish to continue the application in their stead .
In DATE family ORG bought real property located in LOC . In DATE they exchanged that property with another family for different real property .

In DATE the real property in PERSON was confiscated . The area was subsequently divided into plots , some of which were allocated to the first CARDINAL applicants as “ assigned owners ” ( prídeloví vlastníci ) under a deed of DATE .
In DATE the allocated plots were effectively taken over by an agricultural cooperative and in DATE the allocation was formally quashed and the ownership of the plots passed to the ORG .

The fifth applicant submits that in DATE the first CARDINAL applicants donated their claims to the title to the relevant plots to him and that he became their legal successor in respect of these plots .

In DATE the first applicant and the third applicant lodged , unsuccessfully , demands with the above agricultural cooperative for restitution of the assigned plots and for compensation . The claims were based on a special law of DATE , LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . - “ the LAW ” ) . However , they were not lodged with the competent ORG , as required under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of that LAW .
In DATE the applicants lodged a claim for restitution of the land in question under a newly adopted special law , ORG of DATE ( Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . ) . It is still pending .

In DATE several members of family F. lodged a claim under LAW with ORG for restitution of the land in PERSON . They submitted that it had belonged to their legal predecessors at the time of the confiscation in DATE .

On DATE the claimants and the agricultural co - operative which was using the land entered into an agreement on restitution ( dohoda o vydaní ) of the property in question to the claimants . The agreement was submitted for approval to ORG as envisaged under LAW .

Considering that it was questionable whether the claimants had any title to the land , ORG invited them to seek a determination of their rights before a court and stayed the restitution proceedings pending the outcome of such judicial proceedings .
On DATE the ORG ( ORG súd ) found that the land had been in the co - ownership of the claimants’ legal predecessors at the time of their death in DATE and DATE , respectively .
On DATE ORG approved the restitution agreement of DATE . The decision became final on CARDINAL DATE .

In DATE the first CARDINAL applicants unsuccessfully challenged the decision of DATE before ORG in a special procedure outside the framework of ordinary appellate proceedings ( mimo odovlacieho konania ) . Nevertheless , the decision of DATE was finally quashed on a protest lodged by the prosecution service .

The restitution agreement of DATE was then examined anew , by ORG ( legal successor to ORG ) , which decided – twice - not to approve it . Both decisions were judicially reviewed and quashed by ORG ( PERSON súd ) .
The proceedings are still pending
On DATE the first CARDINAL applicants brought an action against ORG in ORG for a determination of ownership in respect of the relevant plots .
In DATE the proceedings were discontinued on the ground that the matter fell outside the jurisdiction of the courts .

On DATE the first CARDINAL applicants brought an action against family PERSON They sought a ruling declaring them to be the owners of the land in question and an interim measure suspending the above - mentioned court rulings concerning the title of family ORG to the land .

All judges of ORG declared that they were unable to sit in the case further to a previous incident when the fifth applicant and his son had insulted the president and CARDINAL of the judges of that court .
On DATE ORG ruled that there were no grounds for disqualifying the entire bench of ORG from dealing with the case .
In DATE and DATE ORG requested the defendants’ observations in reply and other information from ORG and ORG .

On DATE ORG dismissed the request for an interim measure , discontinued the proceedings and decided to transmit the matter to the administrative authorities within the jurisdiction of which it fell . The plaintiffs appealed and challenged all judges of ORG for bias .

DATE ORG sought the defendants’ observations in reply to the appeal , an explanation of the GPE challenge of bias , information from ORG and ORG and an amendment to the action in view of the fact that one of the defendants had died .

On DATE ORG quashed both the decision concerning the interim measure as well as that concerning the discontinuation of the proceedings . The former ruling was found to be premature and the latter ruling to be erroneous given that the defendants were natural persons .

In DATE and DATE and DATE ORG requested CARDINAL times that the plaintiffs substantiate the challenge of bias , pay the court fees and complete the request for an interim measure . In the meantime they had withdrawn the power of attorney from their lawyer .
In DATE , in response to ORG request , the plaintiffs’ new representative submitted the missing information .

A hearing was scheduled for DATE . DATE before that hearing the plaintiffs’ representative apologised for not being able to attend due to health reasons . The plaintiffs did not appear . The hearing was adjourned until DATE .

The GPE lawyer then requested a postponement of the hearing which was planned for DATE due to health reasons and the plaintiffs withdrew the power of attorney from their representative . The hearing was adjourned until DATE . Following the latter hearing , on DATE , ORG decided to join the present action to the action of the third and fourth applicants ( see below ) .

On DATE the third and fourth applicants brought separate proceedings against family PERSON for a determination of ownership in respect of the land in question . They also sought an interim measure , similar to that sought by the first CARDINAL applicants .
On DATE ORG ruled , in the context of the incident mentioned above , that there were no grounds to disqualify ORG judges from dealing with the case .

In DATE ORG requested information concerning the case from ORG and ORG . In DATE it demanded that the plaintiffs bring their request for an interim measure in line with the applicable formal requirements and specify who the actual defendants were , given that CARDINAL of the original defendants had died . In response , their legal representative informed ORG that the plaintiffs had withdrawn his power of attorney . The request was reiterated .

In DATE the plaintiffs submitted that they had new legal representation but they submitted no power of attorney . ORG again requested that they specify the action and the request for an interim measure and sought further information from ORG .

A hearing scheduled for DATE had to be adjourned until DATE owing to the absence of the plaintiffs and their legal representative who had informed the court that he had been unable to appear for health reasons DATE before the hearing . The plaintiffs then again cancelled their legal representation .

On DATE ORG held a hearing and the proceedings in the present action were joined with the proceedings in the action of the first CARDINAL applicants . Following the hearing , on DATE , ORG dismissed both actions . A copy of the judgment was served on the first CARDINAL applicants in DATE . The third and fourth applicants refused to accept the service . All the plaintiffs appealed .
On DATE ORG corrected clerical errors in its judgment and requested the defendants’ observations in reply to the appeal .

On DATE ORG held a hearing following which , on DATE , it quashed the first - instance judgment and remitted the case to ORG for re - examination . It pointed out , inter alia , that it was the plaintiffs’ responsibility to substantiate the scope , the legal nature and the factual basis of their claims .
In DATE and DATE ORG invited the GPE representative to submit valid powers of attorney from all the plaintiffs and to substantiate the action .

In DATE and DATE the GPE legal representative demanded that the court proceedings be stayed pending the outcome of the administrative proceedings on the restitution claim of family F. in view of the fact that the administrative decisions on that claim had been quashed ( see above ) . In DATE the plaintiffs appointed a lawyer to represent them in the proceedings . The lawyer submitted the missing information on DATE .
On DATE ORG appointed a geodesy and cartography expert to draw up a report on the land in question and ordered the parties to pay an advance on his fees .
On DATE the plaintiffs appealed against the ruling concerning the expert ’s fees and requested an exemption from the obligation to pay the court fees . On DATE they submitted further information .
On DATE ORG sought information from the NORP and LOC municipal authorities concerning the GPE material standing . It was supplied in DATE .
On DATE ORG decided not to exempt the plaintiffs from the obligation to pay the court fees . They appealed and stated that they would supply the reasons for their appeal later .
On DATE ORG invited the GPE lawyer to submit the reasons for their appeal of DATE , which they finally did on DATE .
On DATE ORG upheld the decision of DATE .
On DATE ORG admitted ORG to the proceedings as the eighth defendant .
On DATE the expert submitted CARDINAL reports . The parties were then requested to submit observations in reply to the reports .
On DATE and CARDINAL DATE , respectively , the GPE lawyer informed ORG that CARDINAL of the defendants had died in DATE and submitted the death certificate .
On DATE ORG ordered the plaintiffs to pay the fees of the expert . They all appealed .

On DATE , DATE and DATE ORG repeatedly requested the GPE lawyer to bring the action in line with the applicable requirements . On DATE the lawyer informed the court that the third and fourth applicants had withdrawn the power of attorney from her .

On DATE a new lawyer informed ORG that the third and fourth applicants had appointed him to represent them in the proceedings . On DATE he responded to the court ’s request for further and better particulars .

On DATE ORG informed the GPE lawyer that the particulars of their claim did not reflect the specification of the land as in the expert ’s reports and warned him that he would be fined if he failed to correct the claim within DATE . The lawyer responded on DATE but did not change the identification of the land as instructed .
On DATE ORG quashed the decision of CARDINAL DATE concerning the expert ’s fees and remitted the question to ORG for re - examination .

In DATE the GPE representative submitted that they had cancelled his power of attorney . ORG ruled again on the expert ’s fees and warned the plaintiffs that the proceedings would be discontinued if they failed to correct their claim .
DATE ORG made inquiries following a finding that the third applicant had died .
On DATE ORG discontinued the proceedings under LAW on the ground that the plaintiffs had failed to pursue the case . They refused to accept the service of the decision . It became final on DATE .
On DATE the fifth applicant made a written submission by which he sought to appeal against the decision of DATE . He made similar submissions later .

On DATE ORG informed the fifth applicant that there were doubts as to his power of attorney to act in the name of the first CARDINAL applicants and invited him to show that he was authorised to do so . In a letter of DATE ORG warned the fifth applicant that it would be unable to continue communication with him unless he produced evidence that he was empowered to act on behalf of the first CARDINAL applicants . There is no indication that any formal proceedings ensued from the fifth applicant ’s submissions .

On DATE the first CARDINAL applicants , who were represented by the fifth applicant , filed a petition ( podnet ) with ORG . They complained about the length of the proceedings concerning the restitution claim of family PERSON and their ownership actions of DATE .
On DATE ORG rejected their motion as falling short of the statutory requirements .

On DATE applicant was charged with the offence of unauthorised use of someone else ’s property under LAW . The charge was based on the suspicion that he had been using illegally a plot which belonged to the real estate in dispute .
On DATE and DATE , respectively , the applicant was committed for trial and found guilty as charged by ORG in summary proceedings by way of a penal order ( trestný rozkaz ) .
The applicant successfully appealed ( protest ) . The order was ex lege vacated and the matter fell to be determined in ordinary proceedings .
In DATE the proceedings were stayed under LAW ( c ) of LAW on the ground that the fifth applicant had become unable to understand them owing to the state of his mental health .
In DATE the proceedings were stayed under LAW ( a ) of LAW on the ground that it was not possible to secure the fifth applicant ’s presence .
On DATE the proceedings were resumed and joined with the proceedings concerning the charge of DATE ( see below ) .
On DATE the fifth applicant was charged with the offences of violence and grave disturbance under Articles FAC and DATE § CARDINAL of LAW .
In DATE the ORG ordered examination of the fifth applicant ’s mental health by CARDINAL experts .
On DATE the proceedings on the charges of DATE and DATE were joined . The proceedings are still pending .
